tool.name: SAGA.pj_georeference.2
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayREF_SOURCE False isArrayREF_TARGET False isArrayXFIELD False isArrayYFIELD False isArrayINPUT False output_data_OUTPUT $output_data_OUTPUT name SAGA.pj_georeference.2 REF_SOURCE $REF_SOURCE REF_TARGET $REF_TARGET XFIELD $XFIELD YFIELD $YFIELD METHOD $METHOD ORDER $ORDER INPUT $INPUT prefer $prefer response $response outputType_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.outputType_OUTPUT transmissionMode_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.transmissionMode_OUTPUT

param.name: REF_SOURCE
param.label: Reference Points (Origin)
param.help: Reference Points (Origin) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: REF_TARGET
param.label: Reference Points (Projection)
param.help: Reference Points (Projection) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: XFIELD
param.label: x Position
param.help: x Position The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: YFIELD
param.label: y Position
param.help: y Position The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Input
param.help: Input The following data types are allowed in the txt file: vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, json, xml

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_OUTPUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: Georeferencing of shapes layers. Either choose the attribute fields (x/y) with the projected coordinates for the reference points (origin) or supply a additional points layer with correspondend points in the target projection.
